info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 26 at 12:38PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Coconino County through 115 PM MST... At 1237 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Downtown Flagstaff, or near Flagstaff, moving northeast slowly at 5 to 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds up to 40 mph, up to half inch hail, and heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Flagstaff, Fort Valley, Flagstaff Mall, Walnut Canyon National Monument, Sunset Crater Volcano National Monument, Timberline, Hutchison Acres, Cosnino, Winona, Bonito Campground At Sunset Crater, Downtown Flagstaff, Doney Park, Wupatki Trails, Fernwood, Sunset Crater Visitors Center, Walnut Canyon Visitors Center, Lockett Meadow Campground, Arizona Snowbowl, Little Elden Spring Horse Camp and Lower Lake Mary. This includes the following highways... Route 66 between mile markers 192 and 204. Interstate 40 between mile markers 193 and 211. Interstate 17 near mile marker 339. U.S. Highway 89 between mile markers 419 and 435. Highway 180 between mile markers 217 and 227. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
